name: The New South Africa Act
description: The South Africa Act passed by parliament in 1909 has evidently been unsuccessful in keeping resolving the ethnic tensions in South Africa. It has handed the Afrikaner the keys to South Africa and resulted in two ethnic rebellions in the short time that South Africa is a concept. A new South Africa Act will be necessary.

name: Milner's Kindergarten
description: It is high time we root out boorish Boer culture and supplant it with the true beacon of civilisation: the queen's English. South Africa is a British dominion and until simplistic concepts such as Afrikaner culture are a thing of the past, there will be no end to ethnic strife.

name: Herald our English Language
description: English is superior to Afrikaans in every way. Many more South Africans, especially those who speak Afrikaans, can already speak it. It is not a crude patois and it does not sound like German. It is the language of business and the language you use when you interact with the Americans and the rest of the Empire. It should be heralded!

name: Attract Exile Settlement
description: Fearful of losing the Afrikaner's dominant demographic position to the English-South African, Hertzog has tried to make South Africa as unattractive to exiles as possible, trying to get them to go Australasia or Canada instead. Not for any longer. The Federation welcomes those who pledge their loyalty to the Union Jack.

name: Support British Companies
description: The Afrikaners had been trying to get their own kind into entrepreneurialism, resulting in some competition from Afrikaners, but it's clear that the Englishman has a better sense of business and that for economic growth one should look at the Englishman. Inefficient subsidies shall now be directed towards those who actually can do business without them!

name: Banish Afrikaans from the Bureaucracy
description: Translating everything to Dutch is horribly inefficient, and only serves to help the language survive. We should thoroughly anglicise our bureaucracy, forcing the Afrikaners to speak English when they want to interact with the government, and we will finally set in motion the assimilation we had been looking to achieve for a long time.

name: Close Afrikaner Institutions
description: All those Afrikaner Institutions founded following the formation of the Union of South Africa have only served to bring South Africa suffering. They influenced and lobbied the government which ultimately led to the illegal republic, and perpetuate ethnic tension by defending Afrikaner culture. Not anymore.

name: Teachers from the Empire
description: By bringing in teachers from all corners of the Empire, from Canada and the West Indies to Australia and New Zealand, we can finally entrench English as the dominant language of South Africa, and put an end to the misery and ethnic conflict the different languages of the nation have caused ever since Britain's ascendancy once and for all.

name: Tea Time for South Africa
description: Now that we have entrenched our position, it will be under our stewardship that we shall see to it that South Africa will never drift from the Empire again. South Africa is, through and through, a member of the Anglosphere now, and it shall remain that way!

name: Empower the Paramount Chiefs
description: Granting autonomy to the local rulers of the High Commissioner Territories will ensure the Paramount Chiefs of their respective ethnic groups (the Tswana in Bechuanaland, the Basotho in Basutoland and the Swazi in Swaziland) shall be loyal to the central government.

name: Develop Basutoland and Swaziland
description: Despite their location between the original four provinces of South Africa, the living standard in Basutoland and Swaziland still immensely lags behind that of the rest of South Africa. A series of investments will aid in resolving this situation.

name: Develop Bechuanaland
description: The sparsely populated region of Bechuanaland is without hyperbole the least developed region in all of Africa, with any kind of construction remaining limited to a few wooden huts in most places. A series of well-placed investments will soften the contrast with South Africa just over the border.

name: Root Out Slavery Practices
description: Slavery has long proven difficult to root out of the High Commissioner Territories, but the recent investment gives us leverage with the paramount chiefs to resolve the persisting issues, by making investments dependent on their action on slavery.

name: Question of Native Autonomy
description: We have decided to grant autonomy to the local rulers of the High Commission Territories, the new Paramount Chiefs of the respective ethnic groups (the Tswana in Bechuanaland, the Basotho in Basutoland and the Swazi in Swaziland). But we need to clarify the extent of the Chiefs power - is it limited to within the borders of the HCT or does it encompass all of their peoples throughout South Africa?

name: Strengthen the Advisory Councils
description: By strengthening the influence of the advisory councils on policy, we can assure that the interests of the Paramount Chief is at least somewhat balanced with both the European and native interests. It will also lay the groundwork for eventual reform into a bona fide democratic framework in the future.

name: Form the Territorial Justice System
description: At current the status of the law in the High Commissioner Territories is rather vague, members of the tribes are usually tried according to their own tribal traditions while Europeans are tried as if they were in South African territory, with certain exceptions. It is time we formalise a system with trained justices specifically to ensure fair trials for everyone in the territories.

name: Reform the Commissioner System
description: We have made our fair investments in the High Commissioner Territories, but at current we still merely have a temporary mandate from the royal government. In parliament in Cape Town proposals are made to pursue the official and permanent inclusion of the territories within South Africa, but the British exile government would need to cooperate.

name: A New Attempt at Reconciliation
description: The hope that we had finally ended the sectarian violence that plagued South Africa since the British takeover of the Cape Colony in the early 19th century has been shattered. Once again, our country was split among language lines over the direction of our country, and once again the devastation has been great.

name: Federal Elections
description: The system in which we de-facto handed political power in South Africa to the Afrikaners on the basis that they were the majority of South Africans with a white skin has terribly backfired, but this does not mean the concept of democracy has lost meaning. By implementing additional measures assuring the power of the states, and of the British diaspora, we can maintain our parliamentary system.

name: War Amnesty Arrangement
description: Some hawks want to prosecute as many Afrikaners as possible for following Malan to his illegitimate republic, but we have to be realistic: this will only breed resentment and at the end of the day they simply followed the orders of an elected government, even if that elected government tread outside the bounds of the law. It would be most wise to only go after those who were closest to Malan.

name: Symmetric Veteran Stipends
description: No matter on which side of the war you fought, you should receive compensation for what you did for South Africa. Some may find it distasteful that we would fund those who fought against the Empire but we ought to recognise that on the ground one often has no choice, and that the course they followed was that of the elected Prime Minister. They cannot help it, and we cannot leave them behind.

name: Restore Bilingualism
description: Because of the Pietermaritzburg administration there was a tendency to only ever use English, but we should restore the status of Dutch (including Afrikaans as decided in the 1920s). It is a pipe dream that we would ever convince the proud Afrikaner people to abandon their mother tongue, and attempting to do so will only breed a movement of resistance against our government. We need a united nation.

name: Curb German Influence
description: Following their victory in the Weltkrieg, Germany has been trying to expand its influence in South Africa, which it seems to have viewed as the least secure corner of the British Empire, which might be lured to their side. It is likely that Germany has been stoking republican sentiment which eventually resulted in so much suffering in our nation. It is time we curb the vile influence the Germans are exerting over us.

name: Reconstruction Efforts
description: Our nation has been scarred by its third war between the Boers and the British in a century. Now that the most pressing issues to ensure the same will not happen again have been dealt with, it is time that the government puts its full weight into the reconstruction. From the ashes will arise a new Federal South Africa, which will hopefully last longer than the Union.

name: Peace and Prosperity
description: The era of struggle between the British and Afrikaner races is finally put to an end. From the ashes has arisen a more united South Africa under a federal system, in which each province, now state, can handle its own affairs. Afrikaner and Englishman alike shall march in peace to a new nationhood.

name: Federation Armed Forces
description: With the end of the Third Boar War we must reorganize our troops and prepare to help in the coming conflict

name: Canadian Advisors
description: With London being strangled by the tentacles of syndicalism, Ottawa has picked up the torch to to lead the Entente into the heart of the red beast. The South African Government has opened it's doors to Canadian Advisors, to expand it's Air Force and fledging Navy, with the goal of supporting Canada in the great crusade against the syndicalists.

name: Canadian Naval Development
description: Several of our ports and docks have seen better days, with many not having been in service since the Weltkrieg. With Canadian investment and 'know how', we have began to overhaul these docks to better assist our Entente allies.

name: Canadian Destroyer Designs
description: With the threat of submarines, comes the advancement of Destroyer Chassis to hunt for the new wolves of the sea. With the latest Entente designs, the Natal Navy can deal with these threats and become the new hunter's of Cape.

name: Canadian Cruiser Designs
description: By studying Canadian cruiser designs we have become more effective in creating them ourselves.

name: Canadian Radar Installations.
description: With the need of early warning systems, Canada has offered to install South Africa's first Radar Installation in the region.

name: New South African Fighter
description: With assistance from Canada we have created our own domestic model of fighter aircraft.

name: New South African Close Air Support
description: With assistance from Canada we have created our own domestic model of close air support aircraft.

name: New South African Bomber
description: With assistance from Canada we have created our own domestic model of bomber aircraft.

name: Expand the Cape Corps
description: The Cape Corps is the first 'coloured' unit to be formed in South Africa, having it's history stretch all the way back to 1781 with the 'Corps Bastaard Hottentoten' - Corps of Bastards Hottentot. More serving in a non combatant roles, Jan Smuts had wished to expand their roles to include front line infantry and to be included into other branches of the military and we will make that a reality.

name: South African Military College
description: With the expansion of the South African military to now include an air force and a navy, it's only natural that these services are provided a place to train the next military minds of the South African armed forces. The college grounds is an expansion of the old Dutch East India Company 'Militere Kweekskool' located in Pretoria, where it helps develop local cadets.

name: The Loyal Dominion
description: Our loyalty to the Crown has not gone unnoticed, as we draw nearer to  our eventual reclamation of the Home Isles, many Britons have rallied to our cause from across Africa.

name: Our Part in the Great Crusade
description: With Entente Advisors and support, Natal will be able to take the fight to Europe and slay the Syndicalist beast that is strangling Europe!

name: British Plans
description: We shall look back to the Empire and her exiles, learning from their mistakes in order to better ourselves.

name: Troop Specialization Program
description: Landing of the shores of Britain will be a difficult task for the Entente forces. It will be necessary to equip a more specialized assault force to take the beaches and ports.

name: Exile Arms Expertise
description: After the fall of Britain to the Syndicalists some exiles have made South Africa their home. Drawing on their and those in Canada's knowledge we have managed to make several breakthrough in arms research.

name: Casualty Minimisation
description: South Africa has a limited manpower pool to draw from regardless, which in part is self-inflicted. However, the advancement of modern medicine and the treatment of battlefield trauma has allowed for Smut to push for schemes to ensure that men are patched up and returned back to service.

name: South African Navy Formed
description: With Hallifax at the helm, the South African naval branches and been centralised allowing for South Africa to officially have a navy. Though smaller, its main goals are to protect shipping lanes within the Cape and provide limited support to the Canadian war effort.

name: Hallifax at the Helm
description: Hallifax, once a retired Admiral of the British fleet has now been requested to take the helm in the reforms required for South Africa to establish its own navy.

name: Retrofitting Scheme
description: Lacking the means to produce ships by any great means, Natal has taken the approach of retrofitting modern weapon systems on older naval chassis. Though this isn't always going to be an option, it's a stop-gap measure that will greatly assist Natal's newly obtained Navy and not drain what little revenue it has.

name: Greater Reach
description: Though South Africa's Navy only mission is the protection of Entente shipping lanes around the Cape, the need to be able to strike around Africa will be sorely needed in the future ahead.

name: Special Boat Service
description: The specialization of just a few troops is not enough. We have decided to expand our efforts and create a dedicated unit to amphibious invasions and maritime operations.

name: Local Plans
description: Jon Smuts had proposed a detailed and extensive plan to reform the South African Army before the Third Boar War. While he may no longer be in service his proposal was sound and provides a firm basis to reform our military.

name: Royal South African Air Force Reformed
description: The South African Air Force before the support from Canada and other Entente forces was nothing more then a few biplanes from a forgotten era and some "acquired" German Junkers. Now with the latest training and aircraft, the now dubbed Royal South African Air Force, is ready to cry havoc and let slip.

name: Support South African Aviation Industry
description: Though Canada is more then able to supply South Africa, the perils of war means that this may not always be a contributing factor. South Africa must be able to provide a small level of dependence with parts and munitions for their Air Force.

name: Integrated Air Recon
description: With greater coordination between the Air and Army branches of the South Africa's armed forces, the use of Scout Planes has become the backbone of these coordination. With eyes in the sky, relaying information to provide commanders better planning and strategies against the enemy forces.

name: Heavy Armour Focus
description: We'll flatten anything standing in our way.

name: Mechanized Warfare Focus
description: Nothing like a stroll through the countryside.

name: Production Techniques
description: To prepare for this next war we must make certain our vehicles are superior to all others.

name: Establish an Armoured Corps
description: To overcome the lack of manpower and to maximise the Army's effectiveness, the creation of an Armoured Corps has been approved. This will be an expensive endeavour, though the benefits outweigh the cost.

name: South African Patterns
description: Although South Africa lacks a robust industrial complex and is lacking in native designs this does not stand true for the Entente. Through imports of Canadian and French designs we can produce vehicle variants fitted to our environments and needs.

name: Local Arms
description: By taking lessons gained in blood from the Third Boar War we have begun to produce a local rifle instead of relying on the older Canadian and British designs.

name: New Smuts Plan
description: Taking elements from the original Smuts plan, we have adapted the lessons of the Third Boar War and observations of the Second American Civil War to refine our doctrine to perfection.
